body: @aravi5 could you please take a look at this PR?

LGTM, +1.
@agozhiy thanks for making the changes.
@vdiravka the PR was updated with the new functionality: added ability to config Drill SqlLine application via drill-sqlline.conf and override using drill-sqlline-override.conf. Please review.
@Ben-Zvi

@vdiravka and @paul-rogers I've reimplemented PR, please take a look.

Cc: @arina-ielchiieva
@vdiravka, thanks for the code review, addressed code review comments.
@vdiravka @arina-ielchiieva thanks for your code review

@lushuifeng Thank you for your contribution to Drill. 
The PR will be merged soon in scope of the next batch-commit.
+1 LGTM
@aravi5 Sounds reasonable. Looks like your proposal fits DRILL-6625 and #1463 PR, so you can include it there.
Yes. DRILL-6733 still an issue with these changes. Changes here are focussed on modifying kafka producer / consumer configurations to fix intermittent failures.

Bechmark:
https://github.com/oleg-zinovev/DRILL-6717-benchmark

Description:
BenZvi - Solution proposed by Ben-Zvi
OZ - Old PR code
Merged - New PR code
Value axis is logarithmic

P.S. I apologize for the delay.
@weijietong  - Sorry I totally missed this PR. Will try to review it over weekend

@aravi5 - Please also change the status of the jira (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DRILL-6625) to 
 **REVIEWABLE**

As a part of PR https://github.com/apache/drill/pull/1464, we discussed that some changes would go in as a part of this PR. Just checked in those changes.

@Ben-Zvi  @vdiravka @ilooner - Please review the new changes.

The design of `TestKafkaSuit` is very similar to design of `MongoTestSuit` and hence needed changes similar to the ones made in [storage-mongo/pom.xml](f5dfa56#diff-e110e2cbfd77d27e85d5121529c612bfR83).

Current behavior is that surefire runs test classes twice - once as a part of `TestKafkaSuit` and the other by directly running classes. To prevent the latter from happening, changes were made (by @ilooner ) in `pom.xml` for `storage-mongo` plugin. Similar changes are made in `storage-kafka`.
Merged in master
Merged in master
Merged in master
Merged into master with commit id 12af476247789a1decba8d4c715bd6c41d6690e8.

@sohami can you please review this PR?

https://github.com/apache/drill/pull/1467 covers the changes required for DRILL-5671. Closing this PR.

@KazydubB 
* The last regular (successful) batch and failed batch can be useful (in case of Schema Changes and so on). I think they are enough. Or when dumping of the more batches can be useful?
* It would be useful to enable (for instance with additional session option) dumping the additional info by leveraging these Trace operators. It could be future enhancement, could you please create a Jira ticket with description how it is possible to improve dump operator context with `DumpCat`.
* What about other comments in CR?
* Did you check your functionality? How does the new info in logs look like? Please create some test cases with mocking exception throwing from different operators.
@vdiravka I've addressed your comments, could you take a look, please?
@sachouche - Please help to review this PR.

Thanks for the contribution, @yorek. Could you also create a JIRA and add it to the title of the PR?
@bbevens @arina-ielchiieva could you please review?
Thanks, @nitingithub. Please do add the JIRA number in the PR. @bbevens @arina-ielchiieva could you please review?
@priteshm Added the jira Number. Thanks!
@Ben-Zvi
@priteshm Done
thanks again @nitingithub ! @bbevens another one for your review.
@vdiravka updated.
@sachouche - Thanks for review. I have address the review comments, please take another look.

@sohami sorry for late update , except fix thread safe problem, this commit also changed the  `RuntimeFilterVisitor` to support a query without exchange that's only one fragment case.Please review, tks.
@bbevens could you please review this PR?

@lushuifeng, thanks for the contribution!

Could you please provide the time of execution of the query with and without your change?

Please note, that Drill has its own framework for scalar replacement and passing value holders to the methods as arguments may break a scalar replacement for those holders.

Also, Drill can generate too large classes. To avoid problems with the class constant pool overflow was implemented splitting the classes into the smaller ones. Is this change incorporates or at least does not break it?

@vvysotskyi Just setters are added, I think others should work as before.
![comparision](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1677203/46063259-d954b180-c19e-11e8-96f7-3a4645161c32.png)
The setup time of Filter changes with or without my change, following my step:
1. toggle the state of exec.optimize_function_compilation
2. query with sql, this one has no cache(the code generated by different state of exec.optimize_function_compilation is not the same): 
`SELECT full_name, hire_date FROM cp.`employee.json` where last_name = 'Bernard' and hire_date >= '1990-01-01 00:00:00.0';`
3. change the constants in sql, hire_date is changed:
`SELECT full_name, hire_date FROM cp.`employee.json` where last_name = 'Bernard' and hire_date >= '1990-01-02 00:00:00.0';`
4. see the profile of the second time in the above

@lushuifeng, thanks, looks great!

But could you please also provide results for JDK and Janino compilers with and without this feature.
And it would be good to know the results for other literals, except strings and more complex queries.

Are there any cases, where this feature breaks something, or cause performance degradation? If no, then no need to provide the option for disabling this functionality.

Regarding unit tests, it may be written considering compiler limitation for method size - somehow may be passed huge string literals, so query should fail without these changes. This test should be sufficient.

@vvysotskyi other tests will be provided later.
This change have been tested in out prod env for a month, no failure and performance degradation are found as far as I know.
Is it better to provide the option to disable this feature by setting the default value to true?
Could you please give more details about the unit tests?

If this fix just improves the performance without any consequences, then there is no need to disable it or specify an option for that.
But in any case, it is useful to see numbers.

Regarding the unit test, generate a query with large string literals, so they will be specified in the methods in generated code, and query should fail with "code too large" compile exception.

@lushuifeng regarding jdbc-all I guess we need to exclude unneeded libs from it to reduce the size or bump the size if there is nothing to exclude. I believe this effects all new PRs so this should be done in separate Jira prior to new PRs.

@lushuifeng, `jdbc-all` jar size will be reduced in the scope of https://github.com/apache/drill/pull/1168.
@sachouche, what is the status of that PR?

PR #1168 is ready; the remaining part is some advanced testing as requested by @parthchandra (using SQL clients) to ensure that all runtime dependencies are there. It seems the Drill internal unit tests do not provide such guarantees. I didn't have the cycles to perform such testing.

Indeed this PR only addresses the "NONE 1st" case. As for the "NONE 2nd" case (following a 1st OK_NEW_SCHEMA) - this would open up the can of worms we saw before - early sniffing the probe side cranks the actual execution there (e.g., another Hash Join below an Exchange) while other parts of the query are still in schema discovery.

Not sure if in all cases where an operator finds it has no data to return during schema discovery, a NONE is returned first. Note that the NONE does have a schema (e.g., so a Right Join can return nulls for those missing columns). Maybe we can increase the impact of this PR by checking all these cases, and documenting/testing that our protocol allows for a NONE to be returned first (i.e. during schema discovery).
Hi, can you please take a look at this when you get a chance? Thanks!
Yes, I'm working on another release and need to finish that. I will try to get to this later today or tomorrow.

#Generated by Git-Commit-Id-Plugin

git.commit.id.abbrev=527ce72

git.commit.message.full=DRILL-6246\: Reduced the size of the jdbc-all jar file\n
git.commit.id=527ce7261b6fc6bf374a3eb0d6c40da6dc34a6dd
git.commit.message.short=DRILL-6246\: Reduced the size of the jdbc-all jar file
git.commit.user.name=Salim Achouche

Tested the drill-jdbc-all-1.14.0-SNAPSHOT.jar from the above branch with SQuirrel.  Tested the following items:
- text files
-parquet files
-json files
-hive
- complex data
-ctas
-create views
-information schema

I did not see any issues.

@sohami  please review , and the travis error message seems strange. I found other failed PRs error message seems the same saying: "The job exceeded the maximum time limit for jobs, and has been terminated".  Do you how to solve it ?
Closing the PR, since https://github.com/apache/drill/pull/1484 was opened which contains full fix of the problem.

@krystaln Could you please proceed and check the same cases for secure cluster as Parth mentioned?

Also it would be good to automate the JDBC testing process as Salim mentioned. Earlier there were issues with these dependencies in the process of validating the Drill rc. Possibly to create a ticket for that issue can be the step forward.
@sohami applied what you suggest.

Automating the JDBC testing process is ongoing.  Like Drill dev, Drill QA has a list of enhancements that we would like to make.  Simba JDBC testing, Simba ODBC testing, Web UI testing, REST API testing, client application testing are all on the list, and we are making some progress.
@gparai , @HanumathRao I have addressed most of your code review comments.  Working on @Ben-Zvi 's  comment on JoinControl.
It has been rebased to the master, ready to be merged.
@weijietong - Can you also please change the first commit message to include the JIRA number and title
@sohami done, really appreciate the effort you made.
@KazydubB, can we get this in soon?
@weijietong - Thanks! I ran the pre-commit tests and few JPPD tests are failing due to some issues related to locking mechanism in RuntimeFilterSink. I will try to fix that and update the PR.

Can you please add a unit test to drop a function using, DROP FUNCTION USING JAR '<jar_name>.jar'; 
and then query the sys.functions table and verify that the dropped function is not in the results returned, after it was dropped.
@kfaraaz  these re unit tests, so we're not using the SQL interface to add or remove UDF jars. It's primarily testing the APIs. Existing functional tests should be covering that.
@vdiravka the version is released, can you review please?
@amansinha100 @HanumathRao can you also review this since you'll have comments on the JIRA.

With this change the jar size of jdbc-all package is increasing beyond limit. Upon checking more it's because of increase in size of 2 files below. Same thing is observed in couple of other PR's. Looks like we have to increase the size of jar as there is no new dependencies are added.

_11846 oadd/org/apache/drill/exec/record/AbstractRecordBatch.class
1265 git.properties_

**compared to jdbc-all in apache master:**
_11470 oadd/org/apache/drill/exec/record/AbstractRecordBatch.class
783 git.properties_

The change should solve the issue. Looks like to avoid similar in future it would be good to get rid of using `com.mapr.db.impl.TabletInfoImpl` in Drill code, because it is marked as [`@Internal`](https://github.com/ojai/ojai/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/ojai/annotation/API.java#L44).
@gparai Is it possible to do it? Or maybe mark it with `TODO` comment somewhere in the code.

@kkhatua I checked there are no existing functional tests that do a DROP FUNCTION USING ...
We need to add functional tests that drop functions which are defined in jar files and recreate and verify.

/drillTEST_FRAMEWORK/drill-test-framework/framework/resources/Functional
[test@dfc3012-45 Functional]# grep -ir "DROP FUNCTION USING JAR" *
[test@dfc3012-45 Functional]#
@arina-ielchiieva updated the PR with an additional commit.

@weijietong  - The fix is in the last commit of this branch (https://github.com/sohami/drill/commits/DRILL-6731-Final) . Please include it in your PR. With this change all the tests are passing if jdbc-all jar size is also increased. Due to the classes in this PR mainly proto generated files, the jar size is exceeding it's limit not because of any new dependency. I am seeing same issues with other PR so it would be good to make a single change to increase that jar size and then commit other PR's with it.

@arina-ielchiieva / @ilooner please review only the last commit, as this is rebased off commit #1483 , which (in turn) is rebased off commit #1484 .
Much of the underlying javascript location, etc is identical to what was done for #1279
@vdiravka yes these changes will be overridden by the Secondary Index PR which is currently in review. For this PR, we just target to fix the failure since those other changes are bigger in scope.
@sohami done.
Thanks! If the changes looks good to you. Please give your +1 for my commits.
@HanumathRao I've addressed comments, please take a look.

+1  to get it merged to get past the current blocking issue.  There could be potential plan changes though (which are not tracked by functional tests) since the  filtered row count now will be higher than before (even though it will be more accurate).   So we should follow up with some more targeted tests.

@lushuifeng a good practice to have clean run on master and then on the branch with your changes thus you will know the reason of the failures. Try to run tests on master first.
@ihuzenko please update the commit message: indicate what actually was changed rather than describing the issue.
